thread.title: Ochi tops Philta tilt
thread.title_full: Ochi tops Philta tilt | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: Ochi tops Philta tilt
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 11, 2015 Japanese Makoto Ochi hardly flexed his muscles and crushed compatriot Kento Takeuchi, 6-2, 6-1, yesterday to capture the PSC-Philta International Men’s Futures at the Valle Verde Country Club in Pasig City.
The 19-year-old Ochi, seeded sixth, broke Takeuchi’s serve five times during the 69-minute encounter to win his first International Tennis Federation title.
Takeuchi, who lost despite being ranked third, had a chance to make up for the loss in the doubles final but he and partner Issei Okamura yielded to top seed Harry Bourchier of Australia and Enrique Lopez-Perez of Spain, 6-4, 6-3.
Meanwhile, the same cast will banner the 34th PCA Cebuana Lhuillier ITF Men’s Futures which starts tomorrow at the Philippine Columbian Association claycourts in Paco, Manila.
Leading the local contingent is Jeson Patrombon, who has an ITF ranking of No. 1,212.
